caption:
This photograph captures a close-up image of a fern leaf, possibly backlit to enhance the contrast and colors. The fern is depicted in a striking deep red and pink hue, which is not common in natural settings, suggesting the use of a colored filter or special lighting effects that imbue the scene with a dreamlike, surreal quality. 

The image focuses on the intricate details of the fern's structure, prominently showing the pinnate leaf arrangement where smaller leaflets (pinnae) are attached to a central stem. Each leaflet is slightly curled and has a textured appearance, with distinct lines running parallel along its length which might indicate desiccation or a particular phase in its life cycle.

The background is dark and blurred, providing a stark contrast that makes the red fern leaf stand out vividly. This lends a sense of depth to the image, emphasizing the leaf as the central subject. The overall mood conveys a touch of mystery and highlights the natural beauty and complexity of fern leaves.
title: Ferns burned from overexposure to the sun because the land was clear-cut and burned six years earlier in Olympic National Timberland, Washington, near Olympic National Park.
